jsonLd.name: Steamed Bao Buns
jsonLd.description: Learn how to make Steamed Bao Buns. This recipe includes 17 ingredients and 5 detailed steps.

text.content: Mix flour, yeast, sugar, and oil in a bowl. Gradually add 140ml lukewarm water, kneading until a very smooth dough forms. Cover with a damp tea towel and let it rise in a warm place until doubled in size (40 minutes to 1.5 hours).

In a bowl, combine minced pork, light soy sauce, oyster sauce, salt, and Sichuan pepper. Swirl constantly while gradually adding 4 tablespoons of water until absorbed. Briefly stir-fry grated carrot and finely chopped onion in 1 tablespoon of oil until softened. Add to the pork mixture along with finely chopped coriander.

Knead the risen dough until it returns to its original size. Divide into 12 equal portions. Roll each portion into a disk-like wrapper. Place some filling in the middle of a wrapper, then fold it into a bao shape. Let all assembled buns rest for another 15 minutes.

Place the buns with parchment paper underneath in a steamer basket, leaving 2cm space between them and the steamer side. Start cooking with cold water over high heat. Once the water boils, reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 15-18 minutes.
Serve the steamed buns warm. Cooked buns can be frozen; defrost in the fridge and steam for 8 minutes, or steam directly from frozen for 15 minutes.
